src.pstb.log package

Submodules

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger module

This module provides a global logger instance that can be used by all modules in the project. Functions are provided to set the log level and output to console or file.

Classes:

DatabaseHandler: A handler that writes log records to a SQLite database. SuppressRepeatFilter: A filter that suppresses repeated log messages.

Functions:

setup_logger: Sets up the global logger instance. set_default_handler: Sets the default handler for the global logger instance. set_log_level: Sets the log level of the global logger instance. set_temporary_level: Sets a temporary log level for the global logger instance. get_log_level: Returns the current log level of the global logger instance. set_log_level_debug: Sets the log level to DEBUG. set_log_level_info: Sets the log level to INFO. set_log_level_warning: Sets the log level to WARNING. set_log_level_error: Sets the log level to ERROR. set_log_level_critical: Sets the log level to CRITICAL. set_output_to_console: Sets the output of the global logger instance to console. set_output_to_file: Sets the output of the global logger instance to a file.

class src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.DatabaseHandler(db_filename: str | None = None, dont_create=False, log_name: str | None = None, formatter=None)[source]

Bases: Handler

Creates a handler that writes log records to a SQLite database. The database filename can be specified as an argument or read from the PYTHON_LOG_DATABASE environment variable. The default filename is the name of the current file with a _log.db suffix and extension. Registers a function to close the database when the program exits.

Parameters:

  • db_filename – The filename of the SQLite database. Defaults to the value of the PYTHON_LOG_DATABASE environment variable or the name of the current file with a _log.db suffix and extension.

  • dont_create – If True, the database file must already exist. Defaults to False.

  • log_name – The name of the log table in the database. Defaults to the name of the current file.

  • formatter – The formatter to use for the log records. Defaults to a simple formatter.

db_filename

The filename of the SQLite database.

log_name

The name of the log table in the database.

conn

The connection to the SQLite database.

cursor

The cursor for the SQLite database.

connect_to_database()[source]

Connects to the SQLite database.

emit()[source]

Inserts a log record into the database.

close()[source]

Closes the connection to the SQLite database.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the database file does not exist.

close()[source]

Closes the connection to the SQLite database.

connect_to_database(dont_create=False)[source]

Connects to the SQLite database specified in the db_filename property.

Parameters:

dont_create – If True, the database file must already exist. Defaults to False.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If dont_create is True and the database file does not exist.

property db_filename
emit(record)[source]

Do whatever it takes to actually log the specified logging record.

This version is intended to be implemented by subclasses and so raises a NotImplementedError.

property log_name
class src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.SuppressRepeatFilter(max_repetitions=None)[source]

Bases: Filter

Suppresses repeated log messages. If a log message is repeated more than the maximum number of repetitions, the message is suppressed. Reads the maximum number of repetitions from the PYTHON_LOG_MAX_REPETITIONS environment variable or uses the default value of 3.

Parameters:

max_repetitions – The maximum number of repetitions to allow before suppressing the message.

max_repetitions

The maximum number of repetitions to allow before suppressing the message.

filter()[source]

Filters log records based on the number of repetitions.

filter(record)[source]

Determine if the specified record is to be logged.

Returns True if the record should be logged, or False otherwise. If deemed appropriate, the record may be modified in-place.

property max_repetitions

Adds a console handler to the global logger instance.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.add_output_to_database(db_filename, dont_create=False, log_name='', formatter='')[source]

Adds a database handler to the global logger instance.

Parameters:

  • db_filename – The filename of the SQLite database.

  • dont_create – If True, the database file must already exist. Defaults to False.

  • log_name – The name of the log table in the database. Defaults to the name of the current file.

  • formatter – The formatter to use for the log records. Defaults to a simple formatter.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.get_log_level()[source]

Returns the current log level of the global logger or None if the logger is not set up.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.get_log_level_name()[source]

Returns the current log level name of the global logger or None if the logger is not set up.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.set_default_handler(handler)[source]

Sets the default handler for the global logger instance. Uses a color formatter for console output. Removes all existing handlers and adds the new handler to the logger.

Parameters:

handler – The handler to set as the default handler.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.set_log_formatter(format_str='{log_color}{levelname:8s} {module:20s}:{funcName:20s}:{lineno:4d} - {reset}{message}', colorize=True, log_colors={'CRITICAL': 'red,bg_white', 'DEBUG': 'cyan', 'ERROR': 'red', 'INFO': 'green', 'WARNING': 'yellow'})[source]

Sets the formatter for the global logger instance. Supports colorized output for console output and will automatically set the formatter for all existing handlers. Colorized will be applied only to the handlers that support it. For example, the StreamHandler supports it.

Parameters:

  • format_str – The format string to use for the formatter. Defaults to _FORMAT_COLOR_STR. It uses the new style string formatting with curly braces {} instead of ()%.

  • colorize – If True, colorize the output. Defaults to True.

  • log_colors – A dictionary of log colors. Defaults to _LOG_COLORS.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.set_log_level(level)[source]

Sets the log level of the global logger. Valid levels are DEBUG, INFO, WARNING, ERROR, and CRITICAL.

Parameters:

level – The log level to set.

Raises:

ValueError – If the level is not a valid logging level.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.set_log_level_critical()[source]

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.set_temporary_level(new_level)[source]

Sets a temporary log level for the global logger.

Parameters:

new_level – The log level to set temporarily.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.setup_logger()[source]

Sets up the global logger instance. Sets the log level and output based on environment variables. Default log level is INFO. Default log output is console. Default log file is the name of the current file with a .log extension.

Returns:

The global logger instance.

src.pstb.log.pstb_logger.unbuffered_console_output(stream=<_io.TextIOWrapper name='<stdout>' mode='w' encoding='utf-8'>)[source]

Temporary changes the console output to unbuffered mode.

Parameters:

  • stream_name – The name of the stream to change. Must be either ‘stdout’ or ‘stderr’.

  • 'stdout'. (Defaults to) –

Raises:

ValueError – If the stream name is not ‘stdout’ or ‘stderr’.

Temporary changes the file output to unbuffered mode.

Raises:

FileNotFoundError – If the file does not exist.
